intro: Myrsine erythroxyloides, commonly known as the red-veined myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that often have distinct red veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Myrsine erythroxyloides is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
